results.title: Jane Eyre by Charlotte Bronte
results.creator_credit: Greg Brenman, LWT and Robert Young
results.brief_description: Samantha Morton stars as Charlotte Bronte’s young orphaned girl, Jane Eyre, who takes the position of governess to the daughter of the mysterious Edward Rochester (Ciaran Hinds), master of a large and eerie house on the Yorkshire Moors - Thornfield Hall. Will she receive the same harsh treatment she has always known as a child - or will she find the love she has always longed for? And what dark secret lies hidden at the top of the house? Cast also includes Gemma Jones, Timia Berthome and Blanche Ingramas. This made for television feature is the tenth screen adaptation of the famous novel.

results.title: Jane Eyre
results.creator_credit: Barry Letts, British Broadcasting Corporation and Julian Amyes
results.brief_description: Featuring Timothy Dalton and Zelah Clarke, Jane Eyre leaves a charitable institution to work for the mysterious Mr. Rochester. Thornfield is a house of many secrets and Jane embark’s on a journey of self discovery, where not only her values, but her chances of finding love and happiness, are threatened. Based on the novel by Charlotte Bronte.

results.title: Jane Edmanson's guide to houseplants
results.creator_credit: Ernest Heffelmyer, Gardening Australia Magazine and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Jane Edmandson hosts this “Gardening Australia” special on houseplants which covers plant selection, containers and accessories, maintenance, repotting, dealing effectively with pests and diseases, over and underwatering, propagation by cuttings and division, popular flowering and foliage plants, unusual plants such as cacti, orchids and Bonsai, terrariums, holiday care and plant scaping.

results.title: Jane Campion filmmaker
results.creator_credit: AFTRS and Television and Radio School
results.brief_description: Director Jane Campion tells Peter Thompson of her beginnings as a filmmaker, and her relationship with the film school. This program includes excerpts from Jane’s films “Girls own story” and “Sweetie”.

results.title: Jane (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Baker, P. Robinson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Social Security”.
Tells about a young country girl who moved to the city when she was nineteen years old. Describes how although unhappy in the city, she is determined to stay until she conquers her restlessness and loneliness and finds employment. One of a series of films created originally for daytime television panel discussions to introduce to the public the range of social services available from Government and other agencies.

results.title: Jana and the crowing hen
results.brief_description: Jana goes to stay with her grandparents on their farm when her mother becomes ill. Jana is suprised to find that her grandmother goes out to work while her grandfather stays at home. Useful in promoting discussions about sex-roles and stereotyping. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. Vol. 1.
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Dimensions of dialogue” is a brilliant indictment of human alienation symbolised by cannibalism; “The Flat” pits a man against a malevolent room in a special effects tour de force; two magicians fight to the death in “The Last trick”; while “Down to the cellar” probes the roots of childhood fear; “Virile games” finds all the world’s a battle field.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent, and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and has inspired fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Jabberwocky” interprets Lewis Carroll’s verse as a last magical adventure before adulthood; “J.S. Bach: fantasia in G minor” probes the mystery of the real with the great composer’s help; domestic mayhem is on the menu in “Punch and Judy”; while “Leonardo’s diary” transports the renaissance polymath to the twentieth century; “The Ossuary” tours the ultimate bone-yard, a monument to the Black Death; and in “The Death of Stalinism in Bohemia” Svankmajer hammers an animated nail in the coffin of Czech communism.

results.title: Jamie: the story of a sibling
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, ONF | NFB and John Howe
results.brief_description: The film shows how the emotional development of children is affected by parental attitudes and by competition for parental attention. Jamie in this film is a ten-year-old, an age when it hurts if you fail to win a parent’s approval, or if you must give way because you are the youngest in the family. Parents who want to know what goes on inside a child’s mind will find Jamie, and the family of which he is part, a provocative, revealing study. Intended for discussion purposes by only depicting the situation. Cast: Ron Cahoon, James Dougal, Jill Foster, Danny McIlravey, Paula McKeown.
